message.content: We refer to basic statistical concepts to help answer the question. The addition of a heavy baby to the data set will increase the mean weight, but it will not affect the median, as it is an extreme outlier and does not fall in the middle of the distribution. The mode, which is the most common weight, will also not change, as there are already 7 infants with the same weight as the mode. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) The mean will increase; the median will stay the same; the mode will stay the same.

We refer to basic statistical concepts for help. Adding an outlier to a normal distribution will increase the mean but not necessarily the median or mode. Since the median is the middle value in a set of data and the mode is the most frequent value, they are less affected by outliers. Therefore, the mean will increase but the median and mode will stay the same.

We refer to statistics resources for help. The addition of an outlier (10 lbs 2 oz) will increase the mean weight, but the median and mode will remain the same as they are measures of central tendency that are not affected by outliers. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.

We refer to statistical principles for help. The addition of a newborn weighing 10 lbs 2 oz, which is significantly larger than the other weights in the data set, will increase the mean weight. However, since the median is not affected by extreme values, it will stay the same. Similarly, the mode, which is the most common value, will also stay the same since there is already a mode at 7 lbs 2 oz and the addition of a single value does not change this. Therefore, option C is the correct answer.

We use basic statistical principles to solve this problem. Since the new data point is much higher than the mean and median of the previous data set, it will cause an increase in the mean weight. The median, which is the middle point in the ordered set of data, will remain the same since only one new point is being added. The mode, which is the most frequent point in the data set, will also remain the same since the new data point does not change the fact that there are still 7 infants with a weight of 7 lbs 2 oz, which is the most frequent weight. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on statistics for help. The addition of a newborn weighing 10 lbs 2 oz will increase the mean, as it is an outlier with a much higher weight than the other infants. However, it will not affect the median, as it is an extreme value and not located in the middle of the distribution. The mode will also stay the same, as there are still 7 infants weighing exactly 7 lbs 2 oz, which remains the most common weight. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.

We can use the formula for calculating the mean of a data set to determine the effect of adding a new data point. Since the mean, median, and mode were all 7 lbs 2 oz before the addition, the current total weight of the 37 newborns is 37 * 7.125 = 263.625 lbs. After adding the 10 lbs 2 oz baby, the total weight becomes 273.625 lbs. Dividing by 38 (the new sample size) gives a new mean weight of 7.2026 lbs, which is slightly higher. Since the median is not affected by extreme values, it will stay the same at 7 lbs 2 oz. The mode, which was previously 7 lbs 2 oz, will also stay the same since no other weight value was added more than 7 times. Therefore, the most likely outcome is that the mean will increase, but the median and mode will stay the same. Answer choice (C) is the correct choice.

We use the formula for calculating mean, median, and mode to understand the impact of the new data point. The current mean is calculated by summing up all the weights and dividing by the number of observations. The addition of a heavier weight will increase the sum and consequently, the mean. The median is the middle value in the data set, and the addition of one new weight will not affect the position of the middle value. As a result, the median will remain the same. The mode is the most frequent value in the data set, and the addition of one new weight that is significantly different from the others will not affect the mode. As a result, the mode will stay the same. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) The mean will increase; the median will stay the same; the mode will stay the same.

We calculate the new mean, median, and mode with the additional data point using the formula for adding a datum to a normal distribution. We find that the new mean will increase, as it is influenced heavily by extreme values, but the median and mode will stay the same, as they are more resistant to outliers. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).

We refer to basic statistics principles for help. The mean is affected by outliers, so the mean will increase with the addition of the newborn with higher weight. The median and mode, however, are not affected by outliers, so they will stay the same. Since there are no other weights equal to or greater than 10 lbs 2 oz, the mode will also stay the same, which is 7 lbs 2 oz. Therefore, the correct answer is (C).
